text: The king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give the people to me and take the goods for yourself.”

After these things the word of the Lord came to Abram in a vision, saying,
“Do not fear, Abram,
I am a shield to you;
Your reward shall be very great.”
And He took him outside and said, “Now look toward the heavens, and count the stars, if you are able to count them.” And He said to him, “So shall your descendants be.”
Then the Lord God said, “It is not good for the man to be alone; I will make him a helper suitable for him.”

Then he said, “Let me go, for the dawn is breaking.” But he said, “I will not let you go unless you bless me.”
There is no one greater in this house than I, and he has withheld nothing from me except you, because you are his wife. How then could I do this great evil and sin against God?”
Then he fell on his brother Benjamin’s neck and wept, and Benjamin wept on his neck.

“You shall not covet your neighbor’s house; you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife or his male servant or his female servant or his ox or his donkey or anything that belongs to your neighbor.”
“You shall not bear a false report; do not join your hand with a wicked man to be a malicious witness.
“Behold, I am going to send an angel before you to guard you along the way and to bring you into the place which I have prepared.
“Tell the sons of Israel to raise a contribution for Me; from every man whose heart moves him you shall raise My contribution.
“You shall charge the sons of Israel, that they bring you clear oil of beaten olives for the light, to make a lamp burn continually.

For how then can it be known that I have found favor in Your sight, I and Your people? Is it not by Your going with us, so that we, I and Your people, may be distinguished from all the other people who are upon the face of the earth?”

‘You shall do no injustice in judgment; you shall not be partial to the poor nor defer to the great, but you are to judge your neighbor fairly.

Even the word spoken gently with you?

“As for me, I know that my Redeemer lives,
And at the last He will take His stand on the earth.

“Yield now and be at peace with Him;
Thereby good will come to you.

And place your gold in the dust,
And the gold of Ophir among the stones of the brooks,

“If even the moon has no brightness
And the stars are not pure in His sight,

“Far be it from me that I should declare you right;
Till I die I will not put away my integrity from me.

“And to man He said, ‘Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom;
And to depart from evil is understanding.’”
Then his wife said to him, “Do you still hold fast your integrity? Curse God and die!”

Because I delivered the poor who cried for help,
And the orphan who had no helper.

“If I have kept the poor from their desire,
Or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail,

“I have made a covenant with my eyes;
How then could I gaze at a virgin?

“Have the men of my tent not said,
‘Who can find one who has not been satisfied with his meat’?

“Have I covered my transgressions like Adam,
By hiding my iniquity in my bosom,

“Shall I wait, because they do not speak,
Because they stop and no longer answer?

“Behold, let me tell you, you are not right in this,
For God is greater than man.

“Indeed God speaks once,
Or twice, yet no one notices it.

“Man is also chastened with pain on his bed,
And with unceasing complaint in his bones;

“My words are from the uprightness of my heart,
And my lips speak knowledge sincerely.

“For He pays a man according to his work,
And makes him find it according to his way.

“Surely God will not listen to an empty cry,
Nor will the Almighty regard it.

“How much less when you say you do not behold Him,
The case is before Him, and you must wait for Him!

“But the godless in heart lay up anger;
They do not cry for help when He binds them.

“He delivers the afflicted in their affliction,
And opens their ear in time of oppression.

“But you were full of judgment on the wicked;
Judgment and justice take hold of you.

“Be careful, do not turn to evil,
For you have preferred this to affliction.

Can a man be pure before his Maker?

But now my eye sees You;

“Behold, how happy is the man whom God reproves,
So do not despise the discipline of the Almighty.

“You will come to the grave in full vigor,
Like the stacking of grain in its season.

“For the despairing man there should be kindness from his friend;
So that he does not forsake the fear of the Almighty.

“He will yet fill your mouth with laughter
And your lips with shouting.

“If you would seek God
And implore the compassion of the Almighty,

Whoever secretly slanders his neighbor, him I will destroy;
No one who has a haughty look and an arrogant heart will I endure.

O Lord, You have heard the desire of the humble;
You will strengthen their heart, You will incline Your ear

He has regarded the prayer of the destitute
And has not despised their prayer.

Just as a father has compassion on his children,
So the Lord has compassion on those who fear Him.

Bless the Lord, all you His hosts,
You who serve Him, doing His will.

Bless the Lord, O my soul,
And forget none of His benefits;

Who satisfies your years with good things,
So that your youth is renewed like the eagle.

The Lord is compassionate and gracious,
Slow to anger and abounding in lovingkindness.

They all wait for You
To give them their food in due season.

I will sing to the Lord as long as I live;
I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.

Let sinners be consumed from the earth
And let the wicked be no more.
Bless the Lord, O my soul.
Praise the Lord!

Then they despised the pleasant land;
They did not believe in His word,

There were those who dwelt in darkness and in the shadow of death,
Prisoners in misery and chains,

Fools, because of their rebellious way,
And because of their iniquities, were afflicted.

He caused the storm to be still,
So that the waves of the sea were hushed.

Also He blesses them and they multiply greatly,
And He does not let their cattle decrease.

He pours contempt upon princes
And makes them wander in a pathless waste.

They wandered in the wilderness in a desert region;
They did not find a way to an inhabited city.

With my mouth I will give thanks abundantly to the Lord;
And in the midst of many I will praise Him.

In return for my love they act as my accusers;
But I am in prayer.

He will drink from the brook by the wayside;
Therefore He will lift up His head.

How blessed is the man who does not walk in the counsel of the wicked,
Nor stand in the path of sinners,
Nor sit in the seat of scoffers!

Praise the Lord!
How blessed is the man who fears the Lord,
Who greatly delights in His commandments.

Light arises in the darkness for the upright;
He is gracious and compassionate and righteous.

It is well with the man who is gracious and lends;
He will maintain his cause in judgment.

Who is like the Lord our God,
Who is enthroned on high,

Not to us, O Lord, not to us,
But to Your name give glory
Because of Your lovingkindness, because of Your truth.

May the Lord give you increase,
You and your children.

I shall pay my vows to the Lord,
Oh may it be in the presence of all His people,

From my distress I called upon the Lord;
The Lord answered me and set me in a large place.

It is better to take refuge in the Lord
Than to trust in man.

Your word I have treasured in my heart,
That I may not sin against You.

With my lips I have told of
All the ordinances of Your mouth.

How blessed are those whose way is blameless,
Who walk in the law of the Lord.

I will meditate on Your precepts
And regard Your ways.

I rejoice at Your word,
As one who finds great spoil.

Those who love Your law have great peace,
And nothing causes them to stumble.

Open my eyes, that I may behold
Wonderful things from Your law.

My soul is crushed with longing
After Your ordinances at all times.

Your testimonies also are my delight;
They are my counselors.

My soul cleaves to the dust;
Revive me according to Your word.

I have chosen the faithful way;
I have placed Your ordinances before me.

Give me understanding, that I may observe Your law
And keep it with all my heart.

I shall delight in Your commandments,
Which I love.

Oh that my ways may be established
To keep Your statutes!

I considered my ways
And turned my feet to Your testimonies.

Then I shall not be ashamed
When I look upon all Your commandments.

At midnight I shall rise to give thanks to You
Because of Your righteous ordinances.

I am a companion of all those who fear You,
And of those who keep Your precepts.

Teach me good discernment and knowledge,
For I believe in Your commandments.

Before I was afflicted I went astray,
But now I keep Your word.

You are good and do good;
Teach me Your statutes.

The law of Your mouth is better to me
Than thousands of gold and silver pieces.

How can a young man keep his way pure?
By keeping it according to Your word.

I am for peace, but when I speak,
They are for war.

He will not allow your foot to slip;
He who keeps you will not slumber.

I was glad when they said to me,
“Let us go to the house of the Lord.”

Our soul has escaped as a bird out of the snare of the trapper;
The snare is broken and we have escaped.

“Because of the devastation of the afflicted, because of the groaning of the needy,
Now I will arise,” says the Lord; “I will set him in the safety for which he longs.”

Those who trust in the Lord
Are as Mount Zion, which cannot be moved but abides forever.

Unless the Lord builds the house,
They labor in vain who build it;
Unless the Lord guards the city,
The watchman keeps awake in vain.

Behold, children are a gift of the Lord,
The fruit of the womb is a reward.

How blessed is everyone who fears the Lord,
Who walks in His ways.

“Many times they have persecuted me from my youth up;
Yet they have not prevailed against me.

If You, Lord, should mark iniquities,
O Lord, who could stand?

Behold, how good and how pleasant it is
For brothers to dwell together in unity!

If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
May my right hand forget her skill.

On the day I called, You answered me;
You made me bold with strength in my soul.

Search me, O God, and know my heart;
Try me and know my anxious thoughts;

Rescue me and deliver me out of the hand of aliens,
Whose mouth speaks deceit
And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

All Your works shall give thanks to You, O Lord,
And Your godly ones shall bless You.

The Lord is near to all who call upon Him,
To all who call upon Him in truth.

He does not delight in the strength of the horse;
He does not take pleasure in the legs of a man.

Let the godly ones exult in glory;
Let them sing for joy on their beds.

Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgment,
Nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous.

O Lord, who may abide in Your tent?
Who may dwell on Your holy hill?

I said to the Lord, “You are my Lord;
I have no good besides You.”

The Lord is the portion of my inheritance and my cup;
You support my lot.

I have set the Lord continually before me;
Because He is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.

As for the deeds of men, by the word of Your lips
I have kept from the paths of the violent.

My steps have held fast to Your paths.
My feet have not slipped.

Keep me as the apple of the eye;
Hide me in the shadow of Your wings
“I love You, O Lord, my strength.”

He sent from on high, He took me;
He drew me out of many waters.

He brought me forth also into a broad place;
He rescued me, because He delighted in me.

For I have kept the ways of the Lord,
And have not wickedly departed from my God.

I was also blameless with Him,
And I kept myself from my iniquity.

With the kind You show Yourself kind;
With the blameless You show Yourself blameless;

For by You I can run upon a troop;
And by my God I can leap over a wall.

You enlarge my steps under me,
And my feet have not slipped.

Moreover, by them Your servant is warned;
In keeping them there is great reward.
Who can discern his errors? Acquit me of hidden faults.

Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart
Be acceptable in Your sight,
O Lord, my rock and my Redeemer.

The law of the Lord is perfect, restoring the soul;
The testimony of the Lord is sure, making wise the simple.

May He grant you your heart’s desire
And fulfill all your counsel!

Some boast in chariots and some in horses,
But we will boast in the name of the Lord, our God.

They have bowed down and fallen,
But we have risen and stood upright.

He asked life of You,
You gave it to him,
Length of days forever and ever.

Be not far from me, for trouble is near;
For there is none to help.

Save me from the lion’s mouth;
From the horns of the wild oxen You answer me.

The Lord is my shepherd,
I shall not want.

Surely goodness and lovingkindness will follow me all the days of my life,
And I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever.

Who may ascend into the hill of the Lord?
And who may stand in His holy place?

For Your name’s sake, O Lord,
Pardon my iniquity, for it is great.

His soul will abide in prosperity,
And his descendants will inherit the land.

Turn to me and be gracious to me,
For I am lonely and afflicted.

Look upon my affliction and my trouble,
And forgive all my sins.

I do not sit with deceitful men,
Nor will I go with pretenders.

O Lord, I love the habitation of Your house
And the place where Your glory dwells.

Though a host encamp against me,
My heart will not fear;
Though war arise against me,
In spite of this I shall be confident.

One thing I have asked from the Lord, that I shall seek:
That I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life,
To behold the beauty of the Lord
And to meditate in His temple.

You have turned for me my mourning into dancing;
You have loosed my sackcloth and girded me with gladness,

O Lord my God,
I cried to You for help, and You healed me.

For His anger is but for a moment,
His favor is for a lifetime;
Weeping may last for the night,
But a shout of joy comes in the morning.

Now as for me, I said in my prosperity,
“I will never be moved.”

My times are in Your hand;
Deliver me from the hand of my enemies and from those who persecute me.

Be strong and let your heart take courage,
All you who hope in the Lord.

Into Your hand I commit my spirit;
You have ransomed me, O Lord, God of truth.

How blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven,
Whose sin is covered!

Be glad in the Lord and rejoice, you righteous ones;
And shout for joy, all you who are upright in heart.

When I kept silent about my sin, my body wasted away
Through my groaning all day long.

I will instruct you and teach you in the way which you should go;
I will counsel you with My eye upon you.

The king is not saved by a mighty army;
A warrior is not delivered by great strength.

Sing to Him a new song;
Play skillfully with a shout of joy.

For He spoke, and it was done;
He commanded, and it stood fast.

I will bless the Lord at all times;
His praise shall continually be in my mouth.

The Lord is near to the brokenhearted
And saves those who are crushed in spirit.

Many are the afflictions of the righteous,
But the Lord delivers him out of them all.

I sought the Lord, and He answered me,
And delivered me from all my fears.

This poor man cried, and the Lord heard him
And saved him out of all his troubles.

The angel of the Lord encamps around those who fear Him,
And rescues them.

I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people
Who have set themselves against me round about.

How precious is Your lovingkindness, O God!
And the children of men take refuge in the shadow of Your wings.

Do not fret because of evildoers,
Be not envious toward wrongdoers.

Better is the little of the righteous
Than the abundance of many wicked.

I have been young and now I am old,
Yet I have not seen the righteous forsaken
Or his descendants begging bread.

Delight yourself in the Lord;
And He will give you the desires of your heart.

Commit your way to the Lord,
Trust also in Him, and He will do it.

Cease from anger and forsake wrath;
Do not fret; it leads only to evildoing.

For I confess my iniquity;
I am full of anxiety because of my sin.

My wounds grow foul and fester
Because of my folly.

I said, “I will guard my ways
That I may not sin with my tongue;
I will guard my mouth as with a muzzle
While the wicked are in my presence.”

I waited patiently for the Lord;
And He inclined to me and heard my cry.

How blessed is he who considers the helpless;
The Lord will deliver him in a day of trouble.

As for me, I said, “O Lord, be gracious to me;
Heal my soul, for I have sinned against You.”

As the deer pants for the water brooks,
So my soul pants for You, O God.

Why are you in despair, O my soul?
And why have you become disturbed within me?
Hope in God, for I shall again praise Him
For the help of His presence.

For by their own sword they did not possess the land,
And their own arm did not save them,
But Your right hand and Your arm and the light of Your presence,
For You favored them.

Listen, O daughter, give attention and incline your ear:
Forget your people and your father’s house;

In place of your fathers will be your sons;
You shall make them princes in all the earth.

God is our refuge and strength,
A very present help in trouble.

The Lord of hosts is with us;
The God of Jacob is our stronghold. Selah.

In peace I will both lie down and sleep,
For You alone, O Lord, make me to dwell in safety.

But God will redeem my soul from the power of Sheol,
For He will receive me. Selah.

My mouth will speak wisdom,
And the meditation of my heart will be understanding.

“Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving

Therefore, being always of good courage, and knowing that while we are at home in the body we are absent from the Lord—
for we walk by faith, not by sight—
we are of good courage, I say, and prefer rather to be absent from the body and to be at home with the Lord.
Therefore we also have as our ambition, whether at home or absent, to be pleasing to Him.
And working together with Him, we also urge you not to receive the grace of God in vain—
Our mouth has spoken freely to you, O Corinthians, our heart is opened wide.
Do not be bound together with unbelievers; for what partnership have righteousness and lawlessness, or what fellowship has light with darkness?

for He says,

giving no cause for offense in anything, so that the ministry will not be discredited,
Therefore, having these promises, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all defilement of flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
For the sorrow that is according to the will of God produces a repentance without regret, leading to salvation, but the sorrow of the world produces death.

For behold what earnestness this very thing, this godly sorrow, has produced in you: what vindication of yourselves, what indignation, what fear, what longing, what zeal, what avenging of wrong! In everything you demonstrated yourselves to be innocent in the matter.
For if in anything I have boasted to him about you, I was not put to shame; but as we spoke all things to you in truth, so also our boasting before Titus proved to be the truth.
For if in anything I have boasted to him about you, I was not put to shame; but as we spoke all things to you in truth, so also our boasting before Titus proved to be the truth.
I rejoice that in everything I have confidence in you.
Make room for us in your hearts; we wronged no one, we corrupted no one, we took advantage of no one.
Great is my confidence in you; great is my boasting on your behalf. I am filled with comfort; I am overflowing with joy in all our affliction.
For even when we came into Macedonia our flesh had no rest, but we were afflicted on every side: conflicts without, fears within.

I now rejoice, not that you were made sorrowful, but that you were made sorrowful to the point of repentance; for you were made sorrowful according to the will of God, so that you might not suffer loss in anything through us.
But now finish doing it also, so that just as there was the readiness to desire it, so there may be also the completion of it by your ability.
at this present time your abundance being a supply for their need, so that their abundance also may become a supply for your need, that there may be equality;
as it is written, “He who gathered much did not have too much, and he who gathered little had no lack.”

for we have regard for what is honorable, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.

begging us with much urging for the favor of participation in the support of the saints,

Thanks be to God for His indescribable gift!
Now this I say, he who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and he who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully.

I have been crucified with Christ; and it is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me; and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave Himself up for me.

You observe days and months and seasons and years.
So have I become your enemy by telling you the truth?

But if you bite and devour one another, take care that you are not consumed by one another.
But I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not carry out the desire of the flesh.
But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the Law.

Now those who belong to Christ Jesus have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires.
If we live by the Spirit, let us also walk by the Spirit.
Let us not become boastful, challenging one another, envying one another.
For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision means anything, but faith working through love.

But may it never be that I would boast, except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world.
For neither is circumcision anything, nor uncircumcision, but a new creation.

But each one must examine his own work, and then he will have reason for boasting in regard to himself alone, and not in regard to another.

but speaking the truth in love, we are to grow up in all aspects into Him who is the head, even Christ,

that, in reference to your former manner of life, you lay aside the old self, which is being corrupted in accordance with the lusts of deceit,

according to my earnest expectation and hope, that I will not be put to shame in anything, but that with all boldness, Christ will even now, as always, be exalted in my body, whether by life or by death.

Finally, brethren, whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is right, whatever is pure, whatever is lovely, whatever is of good repute, if there is any excellence and if anything worthy of praise, dwell on these things.

So, as those who have been chosen of God, holy and beloved, put on a heart of compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness and patience;

Wives, be subject to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.
Husbands, love your wives and do not be embittered against them.

We urge you, brethren, admonish the unruly, encourage the fainthearted, help the weak, be patient with everyone.

Rejoice always;
pray without ceasing;

so then let us not sleep as others do, but let us be alert and sober.
